messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] unschooling gathering in DC
messages.msgSnippet: Oh,  how I wish it were possible for us!!  I am in a real r-u-t with lack of unschooling support.  I have persevered this far ( school year )  with a field
messages.messageBody:
Oh, how I wish it were possible for us!! I am in a real r-u-t with lack of
unschooling support. I have persevered this far ("school year") with a
'field trip' and 'gym class' group.....it's more wearing than I expected -
the constant discussions of curriculum. Why taching our children Latin is
*essential* (though none of the moms took it save one with 2 yrs in high
school)! And the askance looks when I respond to questions about our
curriculum usage. ( I usually say something along the lines.....we don't
use a specific curriculum, we draw from a large variety of resources.) Of
course, the fact that my 10 yr old is a late reader has clinched for them
that my lack of specific curriculum causes failure.
Susan, venting over for the day!!!

----- Original Message -----
From: "joanna514" <Wilkinson6@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, March 28, 2002 10:12 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] unschooling gathering in DC


> Just to give an update, there are atleast 5 families planning to come
> this day.
> If you're near the area and want to meet other unschoolers, come on
> out!
> I'm hoping for warm and sunny that day.
> Joanna
>
> --- In Unschooling-dotcom@y..., <ElissaJC@c...> wrote:
>
> > >Wednesday April 3, 2002 there will be a meeting of the like-minds!
> > >Unschoolers from around the area (DC) will converge upon the
> National mall
> > >by the thousands...er.. well, a few unschooling families from the
> national
> > >unschooling email loops (Always Learning and Unschooling-dotcom and
> > >homesteading homeschoolers) are meeting in front of the Museum of
> Natural
> > >History at 11:00 am. Some families are driving a couple hours to
> meet other
> > >unschoolers.
> > >Let's get down there and show our support to those who may have no
> other
> > >unschooling families in their area. Pack snacks, we'll sit under a
> cherry
> > >tree and chat, the kids can run and if the spirit moves us to
> actually DO
> > >something, we will !
> > >Montgomery and Frederick county folks may want to meet at the
> Shady Grove
> > >satellite parking lot at 10:00. Parking is free and a shuttle bus
> (also
> > >free) will take us right to the station.
> > >Please feel free to spread the words to other unschooling
> families, the
> > more
> > >the merrier!
> > >~Elissa Cleaveland
> > >"It is nothing short of a miracle that the modern methods of
> instruction
> > >have
> > >not yet entirely strangled the holy curiosity of inquiry." A.
> Einstein
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > >http://www.egroups.com/group/MarylandUFC
> > >
> > >To unsubscribe from this group, send an email to:
> > >MarylandUFC-unsubscribe@o...
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > >Your use of Yahoo! Groups is subject to
> http://docs.yahoo.com/info/terms/
> > >
> > >
> > >
>

messages.messageBody:
Just to give an update, there are atleast 5 families planning to come
this day.
If you're near the area and want to meet other unschoolers, come on
out!
I'm hoping for warm and sunny that day.
Joanna

messages.subject: Fw: [MarylandUFC] unschooling gathering in DC
messages.messageBody:
>Wednesday April 3, 2002 there will be a meeting of the like-minds!
>Unschoolers from around the area (DC) will converge upon the National mall
>by the thousands...er.. well, a few unschooling families from the national
>unschooling email loops (Always Learning and Unschooling-dotcom and
>homesteading homeschoolers) are meeting in front of the Museum of Natural
>History at 11:00 am. Some families are driving a couple hours to meet other
>unschoolers.
>Let's get down there and show our support to those who may have no other
>unschooling families in their area. Pack snacks, we'll sit under a cherry
>tree and chat, the kids can run and if the spirit moves us to actually DO
>something, we will !
>Montgomery and Frederick county folks may want to meet at the Shady Grove
>satellite parking lot at 10:00. Parking is free and a shuttle bus (also
>free) will take us right to the station.
>Please feel free to spread the words to other unschooling families, the
more
>the merrier!
>~Elissa Cleaveland
>"It is nothing short of a miracle that the modern methods of instruction
>have
>not yet entirely strangled the holy curiosity of inquiry." A. Einstein
>
>
>
>
